title: Bake Off Odds: Who's the bookies' favourite to win GBBO?
text:
Good luck to the three Finalists: Alice, David and Steph. #GBBOFinal pic.twitter.com/CDem1HCzGL — British Bake Off (@BritishBakeOff) October 29, 2019

Bake Off 2019 has its final serving tonight.

No more leftovers for the crew, no more shocking Baklava revelations and no more ‘big organ’ innuendos – well, at least until next year.

Who’ll take home the crown?

The viewers’ favourite has already been revealed, but do the bookies agree with the fans? Read on to find out…

What are the Great British Bake Off odds?

Ahead of tonight’s final, Ladbrokes have announced how the final three bakers are expected to finish the show.

Is Steph a sure thing? (Picture: Channel 4)

Steph is the 4/5 odds-on favourite to take the crown.

The pint-sized baker has been consistent throughout the show, winning Star Baker four times.

A Ladbrokes spokesperson said: ‘Steph has consistently been the best baker in the tent, even on her weaker bakes, and it’d be a huge surprise if she didn’t land the prize.’

Can Alice exceed expectations? (Picture: Channel 4)

Alice, who has won Star Baker twice this year, follows at 3/1.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Alice has been busy whipping up intrigue for viewers, who were wondering if she was sweet on ex-contestant Henry.

She described being picked to appear on the show as ‘a dream come true.’

Adding that she ‘felt that to be accepted into the tent gave me the confidence to feel that [she] could bake.’

Don’t underestimate David (Picture: Channel 4)

David, who hasn’t won Star Baker once, is the least safe bet at 4/1.

When he found out he was going to be on the show, his emotions were mixed.

He said: ‘When I got accepted it was such a mixture of emotions. Then I thought, this is really crazy, am I good enough, will I have enough time to practice?’

He made it to the final, he just kneads more self-confidence.

Winning Star Baker the most doesn’t always mean the contestant will take home the ultimate trophy, though.

In GBBO series 5, Richard won Star Baker a whopping 5 times but Nancy was the one who ended up walking away as the winner of the series.

Prue and Paul will be welcoming a new winner into the hall of fame tonight (Picture: Channel 4)

What time is Bake Off on?

Find out if the bookies had it right in tonight’s final.

In tonight’s episode, airing from 8pm, they’ll have to make the ‘ultimate chocolate cake’ for their Signature Bake.

The Technical Challenge will focus on the tricky souffle and finally they’ll pull out all the stops for their Showstopper – an edible illusion picnic which is all about crafting a ‘deliciously deceptive feast’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Bake Off final airs tonight from 8pm on Channel 4.

description: Bookies have revealed the odds-on favourite to win 2019's Great British Bake Off. Who is predicted to win tonight's final?
